meanings.definition: Relating to a form of writing that is not the same as the spoken language.
meanings.sent1: The allographic symbols in the book helped tell the story visually.
meanings.sent2: Her allographic handwriting was neat and easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The allographic font on the menu made the words look like art.
meanings.sent4: His allographic style of drawing brought life to the characters on paper.
meanings.sent5: The allographic illustrations in the textbook made learning more engaging.

meanings.definition: Referring to a representation of a sound or word through a different medium, such as writing or sign language.
meanings.sent1: The allographic depiction of the bird's chirp was shown through musical notes.
meanings.sent2: The allographic translation of the poem into sign language was beautifully done.
meanings.sent3: The allographic interpretation of the song in dance form was creative.
meanings.sent4: Her allographic expression of emotions through painting was truly moving.
meanings.sent5: The allographic representation of the story through shadow puppets was captivating.
